EVJ.A: The global maximum heat value is {1.00}.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Computer Science and Junior or the cell corresponding to Chemistry and Staff?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Chemistry} and {Staff} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Computer Science and Faculty or the cell corresponding to Computer Science and Senior?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Computer Science} and {Senior} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Chemistry and PhD or the cell corresponding to Arts and Senior?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Chemistry} and {PhD} has a higher heat value.

MSR.Q: In the heatmap, what are the row and column labels for all cells whose heat values fall within the range of 0.65 to 0.72?
MSR.A: The cells are: {(Computer Science, Admin), (History, Admin), (Chemistry, Freshman), (Literature, Junior), (Chemistry, PhD), (Literature, PhD), (Physics, PhD), (Biology, Postdoc), (Computer Science, Researcher), (Mathematics, Researcher)}.
